text: Manuel Rodríguez Erdoíza (25 February 1785 – 26 May 1818) was a Chilean revolutionary rebel leader. He led the Chilean War of Independence movement. He was later captured by the Spanish colonial authorities. He was executed for treason in 1818, in Til Til. Rodríguez was born in the city of Santiago. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:People from Santiago Category:1785 births Category:1818 deaths Category:People of the Chilean War of Independence Category:Executed people
title: Manuel Rodríguez Erdoíza
